channel.title: The reason behind "You do not have the newest JDK 5 or 6"
channel.description:
[i]Over the last few days I see at least 1 or 2 topics comming up that say "COMPILER HELP" they say it says I don't have JDK 5 or 6 when I do. The reason for this is because you are using Taharok's perfect compiler.
He built it a long time ago to support JDK 1.5.0 - 1.6.0, Now the latest JDK which most have is 1.6.0_02. If you have a JDK above 1.6.0 it will return the common error of "You do not have the newest JDK 5 or 6"[/i]
There are two options.
[b]Option 1 (For more intelligent people):[/b]
1. Go into My Computer. 2. In the System Properties window, click on the Advanced tab. 3. In the Advanced section, click the Environment Variables button. 4. Finally, in the Environment Variables window, highlight the PATH variable in the Systems Variable section and click edit. Add or modify the path lines with the paths you wish the computer to access. Each different directory is separated with a semicolon as shown below.
C:\Program Files;C:\Windows\System32;
So you would add: ;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin If you where using JDK 1.6.0_02
Then in your compiler put this:
[code] echo off javac *.java pause [/code]
[b]Option 2:[/b]
Use this compiler I made. It should work it detects what version of JDK you have and uses it:
[code]@echo off
:main title Zandia's Compiler v.1 echo Welcome to Zandia's Compiler. I made this compiler because Taharok echo wouldn't give me permission to release the compiler which I edited echo to help use so here is my one I made. I learnt simple batch while echo reviewing his compiler. This only compiles though. I will be updating echo it as Sun Microsystems brings out Java Development Kits 1.6.0_12+ echo. pause goto detectjdk
:compileobject cls %javac% -cp . *.java echo. pause exit
:detectjdk if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting) else (goto detectjdk2) :detectjdk2 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting2) else (goto detectjdk3) :detectjdk3 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting3) else (goto detectjdk4) :detectjdk4 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting4) else (goto detectjdk5) :detectjdk5 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting5) else (goto detectjdk6) :detectjdk6 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting6) else (goto detectjdk7) :detectjdk7 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting7) else (goto detectjdk8) :detectjdk8 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting8) else (goto detectjdk9) :detectjdk9 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_08\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting9) else (goto detectjdk10) :detectjdk10 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting10) else (goto detectjdk11) :detectjdk11 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting11) else (goto detectjdk12) :detectjdk12 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting12) else (goto detectjdk13) :detectjdk13 if exist "%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" (goto csetting13) else (goto jdkerror)
:csetting set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting2 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting3 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting4 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting5 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting6 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting7 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting8 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting9 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_08\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting10 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting11 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting12 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject :csetting13 set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" goto compileobject
:jdkerror cls echo You do not have Java Development Kit 1.6.0 - 1.6.0_12. Download at http://java.sun.com echo. pause[/code]
[b]If your server succesfully compile it should say this:[/b]
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Press any key to continue . . .
Hope this helps.
~Zandia

item.title: The reason behind "You do not have the newest JDK 5 or 6"
item.dc:creator: @Zandia Zandia
item.description:
@Zandia wrote:

[i]Over the last few days I see at least 1 or 2 topics comming up that say “COMPILER HELP”
they say it says I don’t have JDK 5 or 6 when I do. The reason for this is because you are using
Taharok’s perfect compiler.

He built it a long time ago to support JDK 1.5.0 - 1.6.0, Now the latest JDK which most have is
1.6.0_02. If you have a JDK above 1.6.0 it will return the common error of “You do not have the newest JDK 5 or 6”[/i]

There are two options.

Option 1 (For more intelligent people):

  1. Go into My Computer.
  2. In the System Properties window, click on the Advanced tab.
  3. In the Advanced section, click the Environment Variables button.
  4. Finally, in the Environment Variables window, highlight the PATH variable in the Systems Variable section and click edit. Add or modify the path lines with the paths you wish the computer to access. Each different directory is separated with a semicolon as shown below.

C:\Program Files;C:\Windows\System32;

So you would add: ;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin
If you where using JDK 1.6.0_02

Then in your compiler put this:

echo off
javac *.java
pause

Option 2:

Use this compiler I made. It should work it detects what version of JDK you have and uses it:

[code]@echo off

:main
title Zandia’s Compiler v.1
echo Welcome to Zandia’s Compiler. I made this compiler because Taharok
echo wouldn’t give me permission to release the compiler which I edited
echo to help use so here is my one I made. I learnt simple batch while
echo reviewing his compiler. This only compiles though. I will be updating
echo it as Sun Microsystems brings out Java Development Kits 1.6.0_12+
echo.
pause
goto detectjdk

:compileobject
cls
%javac% -cp . *.java
echo.
pause
exit

:detectjdk
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting) else (goto detectjdk2)
:detectjdk2
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting2) else (goto detectjdk3)
:detectjdk3
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting3) else (goto detectjdk4)
:detectjdk4
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting4) else (goto detectjdk5)
:detectjdk5
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting5) else (goto detectjdk6)
:detectjdk6
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting6) else (goto detectjdk7)
:detectjdk7
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting7) else (goto detectjdk8)
:detectjdk8
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting8) else (goto detectjdk9)
:detectjdk9
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_08\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting9) else (goto detectjdk10)
:detectjdk10
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting10) else (goto detectjdk11)
:detectjdk11
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting11) else (goto detectjdk12)
:detectjdk12
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting12) else (goto detectjdk13)
:detectjdk13
if exist “%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe” (goto csetting13) else (goto jdkerror)

:csetting
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting2
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting3
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting4
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting5
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting6
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_05\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting7
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting8
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting9
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_08\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting10
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_09\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting11
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting12
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject
:csetting13
set javac="%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe"
goto compileobject

:jdkerror
cls
echo You do not have Java Development Kit 1.6.0 - 1.6.0_12. Download at http://java.sun.com
echo.
pause[/code]

If your server succesfully compile it should say this:

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.

Press any key to continue . . .

Hope this helps.

~Zandia

Read full topic
